intro: Diplusodon hexander var. angustifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leaved diplusodon, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are typically arranged alternately along the stem. Its flowers are small and yellow, forming dense clusters that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and open woodlands.
